explanation: Sends a silent SYN probe sequence to specific ports using nmap (requires sudo for raw SYN), serving as a TCP knock, then connects to SSH on 5522. Detection: alert on nmap usage by non-admin users; detect low-rate SYNs to unusual high ports; watch for subsequent successful SSH to non-standard ports.
rationale_steps: Emit a controlled SYN sequence as a knock using nmap (sudo for raw sockets).
Remote knock listener recognizes the sequence and opens SSH.
Initiate SSH to the newly opened port.
Detect via EDR process auditing for nmap and IDS signatures for SYN patterns.
